Before Applying.question: What is IPO?
Before Applying.answer:
Initial Public Offering (IPO) is the process in which a private company becomes public by selling a portion of its stake to investors. 

An IPO is generally initiated to infuse new equity capital into the firm, to facilitate easy trading of the existing assets, to raise capital for the future, or to monetize the investments made by existing stakeholders.

Know more about IPOs in our blog by pressing the button below.

Before Applying.question: How to invest in IPO?
Before Applying.answer:
Here are the steps to apply for IPO: 

 1. Press the 'INVEST IN IPO' button below.
 2. You will see the list of open IPOs. Press the 'APPLY' button beside the IPO name you want to apply for. 
 3. In the box on the right side, enter the number of shares you want to apply for. 
 4. Press the 'CONTINUE' button.
 5. Enter your UPI ID. You will get this from your UPI app (Google Pay, PhonePe, etc). 
 6. Press the 'CONTINUE' button.
 7. You will be able to see a timeline of your IPO application process and the tentative allotment date.
 8. Within 24 hours, you will get a UPI mandate request on your UPI app. Approve it.  
 
Done!

Note: The UPI mandate request may come instantly or may take up to 24 hours to come.

Before Applying.question: What is lot size and cutoff price in an IPO?
Before Applying.answer:
It is the minimum number of shares that an investor has to apply for. This is known as the IPO bid lot or market lot size or minimum order quantity. 
 
 Example: IPO of company ABC has a market lot size of 100 shares. So an investor can apply for 100 shares, or 200 shares, or 300 shares, and so on.

The cutoff price is the maximum price for a particular IPO. Eg. price range for ABC company's IPO is Rs 100-105 then Rs 105 is the cutoff price.

Before Applying.question: How many bids can I place?
Before Applying.answer: You can place a maximum of 3 bids.

Before Applying.question: How to place IPO application via ASBA?
Before Applying.answerHtml: Please read our blog using the button below to place an IPO application on ASBA.

Before Applying.question: What amount will be blocked if I place more than 1 bid?
Before Applying.answer:
If you place multiple bids, the bid with the maximum amount will get blocked.

Example: 
Bid 1: 1 lot of 10 shares at Rs 20 per share
Bid 2: 2 lots of 10 shares at Rs 18 per share

Then the amount blocked will be 2x10x18 = Rs 360

Before Applying.question: What is the minimum and maximum amount which I can invest in an IPO?
Before Applying.answer: The minimum amount depends on the lot size and the price band defined by the company. The maximum amount you can place a bid for is Rs 2 lakhs.

Before Applying.question: Can I apply for an IPO on multiple platforms?
Before Applying.answer: You can place 1 application per PAN card regardless of which platforms you use.

Before Applying.question: Can I use my Groww Balance or Net Banking for IPO application?
Before Applying.answer: No, currently only UPI apps can be used to place an IPO bid. Press the button below to see a list of all eligible UPI apps.

Allotment.question: When will I get the IPO shares allotment?
Allotment.answer: Once the shares are allocated, we will receive the shares from the company. We will then credit those shares to your demat account. There is no fixed timeline for when this happens. But it happens before the listing date so you do not face any issue if you want to sell the stock.

Allotment.question: I did not get an IPO allotment. When will my amount get unblocked?
Allotment.answer: The amount unblock process is not handled by Groww. It gets unblocked after the mandate expires. Check your UPI app to know when your mandate expires. Reach out to your bank for further details.

Allotment.question: Why did I not get an allotment?
Allotment.answer: In case the IPO was oversubscribed, the allotment happens via a lottery system. Allotment is done randomly on the basis of PAN.

Allotment.question: Shares have been allocated to me but they are not visible in my holdings.
Allotment.answer: Once we receive the shares from the company, we will credit them to your demat account. There is no fixed timeline for when this happens. But it happens before the listing date so you do not face any issue if you want to sell the stock.

Allotment.question: I got an IPO allotment. When can I trade the shares?
Allotment.answer: You can trade those shares on the listing date. The company normally informs investors about the listing date in advance.

Allotment.question: What is my allotment status?
Allotment.answer:
You can check your allotment status on the Registrar website by entering your application ID.

Press the button below to check.

Applying.question: My IPO application status is not updated on Groww.
Applying.answer: Sometimes it takes time to update the application number. Be assured that we are processing your order. You will be able to see the application number soon.

Applying.question: I am not able to reapply for the IPO after cancelling my order.
Applying.answer:
If you are canceling your order after market hours (5 pm - 11 am), you will have to wait until the market opens to place a fresh order.

The markets open at 9:15 am on all working days.

Applying.question: I canceled my order. When will my amount get unblocked?
Applying.answer: The amount unblock process is not handled by Groww. It gets unblocked after the mandate expires. Check your UPI app to know when your mandate expires. Reach out to your bank for further details.

UPI Mandate.question: I have not received a UPI mandate request till now. What should I do?
UPI Mandate.answer:
UPI mandate requests can take up to 24 hours. Please check your UPI app after some time. 

If the request doesn't come in 24 hours, you will have to cancel and apply again.

UPI Mandate.question: How can I find the IPO mandate on my UPI app?
UPI Mandate.answer: The procedure is different for different apps. Press the appropriate button below based on the UPI app you are using.

UPI Mandate.question: The UPI mandate request failed on my UPI app. What should I do?
UPI Mandate.answer: This can happen due to various technical glitches with your bank or UPI app. We request you to cancel your application and start a fresh one.

UPI Mandate.question: What does blocked amount mean in UPI?
UPI Mandate.answer: The amount required to place the bid gets blocked in your bank account. It does not get debited from your account. Once the IPO process is over, the amount will be unblocked if you do not get an allotment.
